citation.article-title: Streptococcus hyointestinalis, a new species from the gut of swine

p.s: Description of Streptococcus hyointestinalis sp. nov.
Streptococcus hyointestinalis (hy. o. in. tes. ti. na' lis. G.n.. hyos, pig; L. adj. intestinalis, associated with intestines; L. adj. hyointestinalis, associated with pig intestines)
Gram-positive cocci forming chains in broth and sediment with clear supernatant.

Colonies are transparent, 1 to 1.5 mm in diameter after 1 day of incubation, 1.5 to 2.5 mm in diameter after 3 days of incubation, and circular with entire edges and narrow zones of incomplete hemolysis on blood agar.
Not resistant to 6.5% NaCl or 40% bile.

Positive for amylase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, acetoin (Voges-Proskauer test), esculin hydrolysis, and acid production from glucose, fructose, mannose, galactose, lactose, N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, salicin, maltose, saccharose, trehalose, and starch.

Negative for β-glucuronidase, β-galactosidase, pyrrolidonylarylamidase, arginine dehydrolase, hippurate, hyaluronidase, and acid production from glycerol, erytritol, D- and L-arabinose, ribose, D- and L-xylose, adonitol, α-methylxyloside, L-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, α-methyl-D-glucoside, glycogen, xylitol, D-turanose, L-lyxose, D-tagatose, L-fucose, D- and L-arabitol, gluconate, and 2- and 5-ketogluconate.
No dextran or levan is produced from saccharose.
Variable α-galactosidase, β-gentiobiose, raffinose, amygdalin, and cellobiose reactions.
No reaction with streptococcal group A, B, C, D, F, and G antisera.
Guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA, 42 to 43 mol%.
The type strain is strain DSM 20770 (= S93).
This strain is α-galactosidase positive and produces acid from β-gentiobiose, raffinose, amygdalin, and cellobiose.
Other characteristics are as indicated above.
